dmca.title: [ABUSE] Acceptable Use Policy Request
dmca.body:
To Whom It May Concern:

Please note that below-referenced copyright infringement notice does not
substantially comply with the required notification elements of the Digital
Millennium Copyright Act of 1998 ("DMCA").

Please note that we have not passed on the substantive merits of your claim.

Please visit our web site at www.theplanet.com/legal.
 
Legal Response Team
THEPLANET.COM INTERNET SERVICES, INC. 

-----Original Message-----
From: Policy Enforcement [mailto:abuse@theplanet.com] 
Sent: Wednesday, November 30, 2005 12:55 PM
To: copyright@theplanet.com
Cc: Policy Enforcement
Subject: Fwd: [ABUSE] Acceptable Use Policy Request


For your review.

Martin Gaston
Policy Enforcement
The Planet Internet Services, Inc.
http://www.theplanet.com/legal/

Begin forwarded message:

> From: Jennifer Smith <jsmith@iiwinc.com>
> Date: November 30, 2005 10:11:24 AM CST
> To: admins@theplanet.com, abuse@theplanet.com
> Cc: bwh48@iinet.net.au
> Subject: [ABUSE] Acceptable Use Policy Request
>
> To Whom It May Concern:
> I apologize for taking this action, as it is a big step, and I'm not 
> sure the correct person to contact. I am a writer, and have published 
> articles for syndication on the website http:// www.EZineArticles.com, 
> which has a Publisher Terms of Service located here: 
> http://ezinearticles.com/terms-of-service.html.
> One of your users, who hosts the site http:// www.besttravelideas.com, 
> has ignored multiple attempts I've made to contact him regarding an 
> issue of article republication. He was very helpful when I brought up 
> the same issue about another site of his, 
> http://www.bestwildflowers.com. However, I would appreciate it if you 
> could enforce your Acceptable Use Policy and settle this situation for 
> this second republication of the article.
> Attached, I have enclosed all of the email communications between 
> myself and Mr. Hearder, beginning with the first contact over 
> BestWildFlowers.com, and including the two emails sent in regards to 
> BestTravelIdeas.com.
> Thank you for your time,
> Jennifer Smith
>
> --
> Jennifer Smith
> jsmith@iiwinc.com
>
> Interactive Internet Websites, Inc.
> 2252 Killearn Center Blvd.  Suite 2D
> Tallahassee, FL  32309
> Phone: 850-222-7900
> Fax: 850-668-2731
>
>
>
>
>
>
>
> Yes the site is mine, and I apologise for not displaying your article 
> correctly.
>
> I have tried going to ezinearticles.com to find your article to see 
> what is missing, but I cannot find your article anymore..
> Could you send me your article (to this email address) or send the the 
> full ezinearticles.com URL, and I will make the necessary changes to 
> display all information..
>
> Regards, and apologies..
>
> Bruce Hearder
>
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: "Jennifer Smith" <jsmith@iiwinc.com>
> To: <bruce@hearder.com>
> Sent: Tuesday, October 18, 2005 2:27 AM
> Subject: BestWildFlowers.com
>
>
>> Mr. Hearder,
>> It has come to my attention that you are affiliated with the website 
>> BestWildFlowers.com, so please feel free to correct me if I've 
>> reached you in error.
>> The website BestWildFlowers.com has posted an article I submitted to 
>> EzineArticles.com at the following URL:
>> http://www.bestwildflowers.com/articles/crime-against-travelers-
>> the-caribbean039s-biggest-battle.html
>> While I'm pleased that the website has chosen to re-publish the 
>> article, there is a problem with the posting. It breaks both the 
>> in-text copyright notice and EzineArticles' Publisher Terms of 
>> Service by not maintaining live links in the About the Author section 
>> and by not including the Article Source Credit.
>> Again, if I've reached you in error, please correct me. However, if 
>> you do know the person I might contact about correcting the links or 
>> removing this article from the aforementioned site - if you are not 
>> the correct person - please let me know.
>> Thank you for your time,
>> Jennifer Smith
>>
>>
>> --
>> Internal Virus Database is out-of-date.
>> Checked by AVG Anti-Virus.
>> Version: 7.0.344 / Virus Database: 267.11.13/124 - Release Date:  
>> 7/10/2005
>>
>>
>
>
>
> --
> Internal Virus Database is out-of-date.
> Checked by AVG Anti-Virus.
> Version: 7.0.344 / Virus Database: 267.11.13/124 - Release Date:  
> 7/10/2005
>
>
>
>
>
>
> Bruce Hearder wrote:
>
>> Hi Jennifer..
>>
>> Yes the site is mine, and I apologise for not displaying your article 
>> correctly.
>>
>> I have tried going to ezinearticles.com to find your article to see 
>> what is missing, but I cannot find your article anymore..
>> Could you send me your article (to this email address) or send the 
>> the full ezinearticles.com URL, and I will make the necessary changes

>>
>> Regards, and apologies..
>>
>> Bruce Hearder
>>
>> ----- Original Message ----- From: "Jennifer Smith"  
>> <jsmith@iiwinc.com>
>> To: <bruce@hearder.com>
>> Sent: Tuesday, October 18, 2005 2:27 AM
>> Subject: BestWildFlowers.com
>>
>>
>>> Mr. Hearder,

>>> http://www.bestwildflowers.com/articles/crime-against-travelers-
>>> the-caribbean039s-biggest-battle.html

>>> article, there is a problem with the posting. It breaks both the

>>> Service by not maintaining live links in the About the Author 
>>> section and by not including the Article Source Credit.
>>> Again, if I've reached you in error, please correct me. However, if 
>>> you do know the person I might contact about correcting the links or

>>> the correct person - please let me know.
>>> Thank you for your time,
>>> Jennifer Smith
>>>

>>> --
>>> Internal Virus Database is out-of-date.
>>> Checked by AVG Anti-Virus.
>>> Version: 7.0.344 / Virus Database: 267.11.13/124 - Release Date:
>>> 7/10/2005
>>>
>>>
>>
>>
>>
>
>
>
>
>
>
> You may remember my writing you a couple of weeks ago about an 
> incorrectly displayed article on BestWildFlowers.com. I appreciated 
> your willingness to correct the link issue.
>
> I've found another site which, by the look of it, seems like it may be 
> yours as well. It is BestTravelIdeas.com. The article posted there has 
> the same problem: The links are not active.
>
> Again, if I've reached you in error, I apologize. However, I would 
> appreciate it greatly if you could maintain all of the links as active 
> on all of the copies of this article that you've posted. You'll find 
> the particular instance here:
> http://www.besttravelideas.com/articles/crime-against-travelers-the-
> caribbean039s-biggest-battle.html
> Thank you again,
>
> Jennifer Smith
>
> jsmith@iiwinc.com
> Interactive Internet Websites, Inc.
>
>
>
